channel.title: .:Problem with Port Forwarding:
channel.description:
Ok, well i've been trying to make a server using port-forwarding instead of hamachi. The problem is, is when I type in the IP address for my router or my defualt gateway in the address bar, nothing happens. It brings up a page saying there where no results found. I'm using a belkin wireless router
Model Number - F5D723-4 Gateway - 71.59.5.1

item.title: .:Problem with Port Forwarding:
item.dc:creator: @Kalphiter Kalphiter
item.description:
@Kalphiter wrote:

[quote=“Jordan15975, post:1, topic:217839”]Ok, well i’ve been trying to make a server using port-forwarding instead of hamachi. The problem is, is when I type in the IP address for my router or my defualt gateway in the address bar, nothing happens. It brings up a page saying there where no results found. I’m using a belkin wireless router

Model Number - F5D723-4
Gateway - 71.59.5.1[/quote]Heh, I have a belkin router and it works fine(F5D6231-4)

You type in 192.168.2.1

That is not your gateway.

Now, if you’re using a Windows while connected to the internet:
click the two computers that light-up blue screens by where the time displays.
click the support tab. take the last number of the “IP address field”.

Go to the router thingy. Please note that firefox doesn’t work with the virtual server things so try Internet explorer.

or try: http://192.168.2.1/fw_virt.html

Click Virtual servers(if you have been prompted for a password leave it blank if one wasn’t set), if a password was set and you do not know it ask your parents.

Add as you wish

Now for the first open field you put a name(only will be useful if your parents happen to look at it). Second+third fields you fill in “43594”.

3 radio field stays as “TCP”

4th thing is the IP address ending you copied from before.

Click the bottom button (submit?) than run your server.

If you don’t have no-ip you can go to

WhatIsMyIPAddress.com

What Is My IP Address? IP Address Tools and More

IP address lookup, location, proxy detection, email tracing, IP hiding tips, blacklist check, speed test, and forums. Find, get, and show my IP address.


and connect via that IP(as server field when on a client)

Read full topic

@Zuno wrote:

Do what he says and if the password/username doesnt work try leaving the username blank and using admin as the password (its that way for me :))

item.description:
@dunea wrote:

type in 192.168.1.1 in your address, and for your user name its always admin unless your parents change it, and password is usually password
